bank

Interface Account


  • public interface Account
    The Account interface represents a single account. It can be used to deposit and withdraw money. The amounts are always given in Swiss Francs. References to accounts can be obtained over a bank interface.
    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    Dominik Gruntz
    See Also:
    Bank

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void deposit(double amount)
      Deposits the given amount on the account.
      double getBalance()
      Returns the balance of the account.
      String getNumber()
      Returns the account number.
      String getOwner()
      Returns the name of the owner.
      boolean isActive()
      Returns the state of the account.
      void withdraw(double amount)
      Withdraws the given amount from the account.

    • Method Detail

      • getNumber

        String getNumber()
                 throws IOException
        Returns the account number.
        Returns:
        the account number.
        Throws:
        IOException - if a remoting or communication problem occurs

      • getOwner

        String getOwner()
                throws IOException
        Returns the name of the owner.
        Returns:
        the name of the owner
        Throws:
        IOException - if a remoting or communication problem occurs

      • isActive

        boolean isActive()
                 throws IOException
        Returns the state of the account. An account may be active or passive. A fresh created account is active. When the account is deleted, it becomes passive. Transactions performed on a passive account are not allowed and throw an InactiveException.
        Returns:
        the state of the account
        Throws:
        IOException - if a remoting or communication problem occurs

      • deposit

        void deposit(double amount)
             throws IOException,
                    IllegalArgumentException,
                    InactiveException
        Deposits the given amount on the account.
        Parameters:
        amount - value to deposit
        Throws:
        InactiveException - if the account is not active
        IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is negative
        IOException - if a remoting or communication problem occurs
        Preconditions:
        amount >= 0

      • withdraw

        void withdraw(double amount)
              throws IOException,
                     IllegalArgumentException,
                     OverdrawException,
                     InactiveException
        Withdraws the given amount from the account.
        Parameters:
        amount - value to withdraw
        Throws:
        InactiveException - if the account is not active.
        OverdrawException - if the amount is greater than the current balance
        IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is negative
        IOException - if a remoting or communication problem occurs
        Preconditions:
        amount >= 0

      • getBalance

        double getBalance()
                  throws IOException
        Returns the balance of the account. The balance of an account which has been closed is always zero. An InactiveException is never thrown when the balance is accessed.
        Throws:
        IOException - if a remoting or communication problem occurs
